snippet: Americans spent judiciously as they contended with a payroll-tax increase, income tax refunds that came later than usual and rising gas prices.
abstract: Retailers report that revenue at stores open at least one year rose an average of 4.1 percent in February, down from previous months, citing cold weather, economic strain and payroll-tax hike.
lead_paragraph: Americans spent judiciously as they contended with a payroll-tax increase, income tax refunds that came later than usual and rising gas prices.

headline.seo: Retail Sales Slow in February as Payroll Tax Crimps Spending
headline.main: Weather And Taxes Hurt Sales In February
headline.print_headline: Weather And Taxes Hurt Sales In February
